docs.lead_paragraph: Some months since, a portion of the letters of our European correspondent, " Dick Tinto," having been delayed in their transmission, were upon their arrival, superseded by more pressing matters. As, howover, they have no reference to dates, and are as readable at one period its another, we propose to pub. lish them new, at such intervals as the current topics of interest may leave vacant for tile purpose.-Hp . TIMES.)

headline.main: THE PULPIT AND THE STAGE.; Interesting Correspondence -- Dr. Bellows' Views of the Effect of his Effort to aid the Drama.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEAR SIR: We, the President, officers and members of the Liverpool Garrick Club, desire meet respectfully to tender you our hearty thanks for the very admirable lecture on "The Pulpit and the Stage delivered by you at the Academy of Music, in the City of New York.
docs.abstract: Correspondence with the Garrick Club of Liverpool

headline.main: NEW-JERSEY.; Frederick Cueva's Trial for the Murder of De Grauval.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday was the second day of the trial of this young Cuban, before the Hudson County Court, New-Jersey, Judge OODEN presiding, Though the rain was severe all day, the Court-room was crowded, many Iadies being in the audience, CUEVA was press. ent, apparently an Interested but not an anxious spectator. His father was present, too, but deep anxiety .

headline.main: PARIS GOSSIP.; Gambling at the German Spas--Close of the Season--Veterans of the First Empire--Illness of the King of Prussia--Reported Illness of the Emperor--Miscellaneous News.

docs.lead_paragraph: The so called health-seekers of the spas of Germany begin to return to town, evidently more recuperated in blood molecules than in molecules of gold. The totally bankrupt form a large majority of the homeward emigration. So long as their deposits held out, or so long as their friends supplied them with money--always to return home with--they stock to the rouge-et-noir and

docs.lead_paragraph: The importance of having clean, wholesome and healthy bread, produced economy and dispatch, cannot be overrated, and as our attention has lately been called to the apparatus of M. ROLLAND, which is now used extensively in France, and also throughout the continent of Europe, and to a limited extent in this City, we have deemed it pertinent to present the features of its claimed superiority.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM FRANCE.; The Camp at Chaions--Imperial Visitors--Fall Races of the Bois de Boulogne--American Chapel in Paris--A Telegraphic Breach of Etiquette--American Physicians Killed in the Russian Service, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The camp of Chalons is just now the centre of attraction for ?? fashionable world. The Empress and the Imperial Baby, the ladies of honor and the Marshals of France, have all taken up their ?? at the camp, and are sharing the life of the soldier after the most approved military style. .

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The New-York Post-office Site--The Sumner Court--Martial--Diminished Treasury Receipts--The Naval Courts, &c. Central American Affairs--Expected Failure of Walker. Employment for the Workmen in the Brooklyn Navy Yard.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. J. B. HASKIN called on Secretary TOUCEY today, at the request of the mechanics employed in the Brooklyn Navy Yard, to urge the importance of affording work this Winter for the fifteen hundred operatives there. As the work on the Savannah is nearly completed, there has been much solicitude lest all will be discharged.

headline.main: AGRICULTURE.; Delivered Before the New-York State Agricultural Society, Oct. 9, 1857. Edward Everett's Address at Buffalo.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PRESIDENT, GOVERNOR KING, PRESIDENT FILLMORE, LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, FRIENDS AND FELLOW-CITIZENS: The surpassingly beautiful spot where we are assembled this day is one of no ordinary interest. We are met in full view of the outlet of one of the most considerable of those inland seas which form so marked a feature in the geography of our continent.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; PROPOSED MEETING OF EUROPEAN SOVEREIGNS. Capture of Slavers off the African Coast. Statements by Passengers from India. Effect of the Monetary Crisis in France and England. ARRIVAL OF THE EUROPA. Increase in the Bank of England's Rate of Discount.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following appeared in a portion of yesterday's Morning Edition: HALIFAX, Tuesday, Oct. 20. The Royal Mail steamship Europa, Captain ??, from Liverpool, on the afternoon of Saturday, the 10th inst., arrived at this port at 11:20 o'clock this evening. She has [pound]63,160 in specie. There is nothing later from India.
